file_content.text: Always good to see you.
It's over. Our people are safe from the Empire's threat.
Hear that, Bareesh? How does it feel to back the winning team?
Your victory was never in doubt--and now the Hutt Cartel has taken notice of your power. You've earned respect.
Change is coming, Bareesh. The Cartel would be smart to recognize that.
That's a good start.
No one disagrees things will be different. The real question is, different for whom?
Respect easily becomes fear in the weak-minded. The Cartel must see us as allies, not potential rivals.
We're here to help.
You understand much about respect, Jedi--but little about Hutts. Every ally is a potential rival.
Tell your friends if they even think about joining the Empire, Havoc Squad will be back for them.
We'd blasted well better have.
They are not my friends--and the voices speaking in favor of your enemy have all gone quiet.
Anybody who doesn't respect me by now really hasn't been paying attention.
I already had that.
I like you, Captain. Perhaps we can do business, someday.
Now that the Cartel has seen what we can do, are they ready to kick the Empire off Nar Shaddaa and join our side?
How about an alliance?
You ask too much, too soon. Give things time. I will continue championing your people to the Cartel.
We didn't do this for your idiot government's approval, Bareesh.
The Cartel can go hang itself.
Exactly--and that is why they respect you.
This is a major victory for the Republic. It's a shame we can't go public with it. Not yet, anyway.
Your actions here may go unreported, but you've certainly earned our sincere appreciation. Please accept this gift in recognition of your service.
That's a generous reward. If you'll excuse me, my ship is waiting.
You're too kind.
Material possessions don't mean much. I'd rather we spent some time together.
[Flirt] I only need you.
You seem to have more than enough company. Maybe some other time.
I'd rather have the pleasure of your company. You could show me the nice parts of Nar Shaddaa.
[Flirt] Let's go someplace.
Winning makes you bold, doesn't it? I like that. Say goodbye, Bareesh.
Farewell, great hero! Enjoy your reward.
Now it's just us. Follow me....
I don't know about you, but I'm enjoying Nar Shaddaa a lot more now.
It's a shame I have to leave. I was just getting to know you.
[Flirt] This was wonderful.
Maybe someday we'll finish what we started. Take care of yourself.
Sounds like my work here is done. Be careful, all right? I won't be around to protect you anymore.
It's time for me to go.
You're sweet. Stay safe out there. We'll see each other again.
Feel free to keep enjoying yourself without me.
At least someone is.
Thanks, I'll do that. I'm sure you have someplace else to be. Somewhere far, far away.
That's a bit... abrupt. This really isn't the best time. Maybe we'll see each other again.
The Empire doesn't accept defeat gracefully. Stay safe.
Take care of yourself.
I'll be spending a lot more time here in the spaceport--and close to my ship.
That's it? Next time I'll quote you a price in advance. And if you can't pay....
War pays poorly.
We'll be prepared to meet any price, should we need you again.
You will be remembered as great heroes! I will see to it!
You will be remembered as a great hero! I will see to it personally!
What are you doing back here? Your mission isn't over.
A who's who of Republic heroes. I'm glad I caught you before anyone left.
You're leaving quite a mark on Nar Shaddaa, Master Jedi--but I'm afraid your services are still needed.
Not every day I meet a Republic war hero. Wish I wasn't about to beg you for a favor....
You're the infamous freighter captain who crashed Drooga's party? Not leaving already, I hope.
If it isn't Nar Shaddaa's newest celebrity. This place loves a winner. You should stick around.
Name's Deera Ulyette, Senate Special Liaison to the Hutt Cartel. I work with Hutts who are friendly to the Republic. Yes, they do exist.
An old pal of yours is making good on his promise to aid our cause: Bareesh Fenn'ak Torill. Remember him?
A gangster turned legitimate businessman--or so he says.
Of course.
He's working overtime to rehabilitate his image. We're liking what we see.
I've met a lot of Hutts, and they all have unusual names.
No, I don't.
He'd be crushed you forgot him, especially after all the hard work he's done.
What does that festering blob of criminal filth want now?
He's a piece of scum.
Ex-criminal filth. He's making amends.
Bareesh Fenn'ak Torill sends his regards. You were working with him and Ambassador Averdon to stop the Kintan Kings gang. Never finished the job.
I had other business, but it's done now. Do they still need help?
My own mission came first.
We have bigger problems than gangsters.
Did Ambassador Averdon and Bareesh manage to get rid of those gangsters?
How did things turn out?
No idea--but we have a much bigger problem on our hands.
None of those names rings a bell.
I don't remember any of that.
A Hutt who didn't leave an impression. That's a first.
Bareesh Fenn'ak Torill has deep connections in the Hutt Cartel. He's been feeding us valuable information on the Empire's dealings here.
I didn't know the Hutts were taking sides. Nar Shaddaa does business with both the Republic and Empire.
Hutts are supposedly neutral.
Some Hutts are developing an enlightened perspective. They know if the Empire defeats us, the Hutt Cartel is next on the list.
Just how valuable is this data?
How good is the information?
Valuable enough that you shouldn't leave this planet before you hear it.
Hutts never help anyone out of good will.
I don't trust your contact.
I never said Bareesh was motivated by altruism. He's looking to keep his customers alive. But we can work with that.
Through his Cartel sources, Bareesh obtained classified Imperial intel. The enemy is training mercenaries to conduct sneak attacks on our civilian forces.
The Empire will deny involvement while their mercenary army destroys us. We need to shut down the enemy's operations--all of them.
I won't leave Nar Shaddaa until this threat is ended.
You can count on my help.
You're not one to hesitate. Good.
Once again, the Force has guided me where I can do the most good.
You can count on my help.
I hope you're prepared to offer more than sage advice.
We shouldn't wait for the Empire to strike first. If they want a surprise attack, let's give it to them.
You can count on my help.
You certainly live up to your reputation, soldier.
Every time bad guys try to blow up the Republic, I get real popular.
You can count on my help.
You have a knack for battlefield heroics. Those are always in demand.
You're suggesting we declare war against the Empire?
And break the treaty?
This is Hutt space. We aren't declaring anything--and the Empire is in no position to accuse us of breaking the treaty.
My ship's fueled and ready for departure. Let me know how things work out.
Sorry, but I'm leaving.
Why waste time on your cozy starship when you can stay here and save innocent lives? Whatever you're doing, it can wait.
I guess Nar Shaddaa isn't finished with me just yet.
I suppose you're right.
I'm glad you see it that way, because you're our best hope.
I'm not making any promises--but I'll listen.
We'll see about that.
Bareesh is standing by. He wanted to speak with you personally.
I placed myself at great personal risk to obtain the coordinates of your enemy's staging area. I can only imagine the danger awaiting you.
The Empire trains mercenary killers, builds devastating weapons and operates a horrific interrogation center. Its villainy knows no limit!
If the Hutt Cartel formed an alliance with the Republic, we could easily defeat the Empire.
Help us defeat them.
What goes on in these interrogation centers? Does the Empire have prisoners?
Interrogation centers?
Anyone the Empire believes may possess valuable information goes to the interrogation center for "processing." Their process is one-hundred percent fatal.
The Empire needs to learn there's a limit to everything.
Enough is enough.
Yes! Crush those scum! They deserve whatever fate they receive.
Too few among the Cartel share my disgust of the Empire. They cling to their foolish neutrality and refuse to commit forces to you.
If only I could provide you more than information... I wish you good fortune stopping the Empire's abominable campaign to destroy you.
Your information is most appreciated. We'll take things from here.
Thank you.
If you fail to stop this threat, I shudder to think of the damage to the galaxy's economy.
You give us all this information, but you won't lend a hand to clean up your own planet?
You won't help us at all?
The politics are complicated. If you only knew what I went through to obtain these secrets. I will be repaying favors for years--decades!
Calling you coward would be an insult to the spineless. Thanks for nothing, Hutt.
What a pathetic worm you are.
Insult me if you like! If the Cartel knew I shared this information with you, they'd slow-roast me over the sun!
I'm sure no offense was intended, Bareesh. The Republic is prepared to fight its own battles.
SIS reconnaissance located an enemy industrial complex swarming with heavily armed mercenaries. If that army is unleashed on us, we're done.
Our only hope is scattering those mercenaries and destroying the Imperial interrogation facility. Defeat the enemy before it can mount any attack.
I'll do everything in my power to protect the Republic. The Empire won't drive us off Nar Shaddaa.
May the Force be with us.
We need this world's technology. Losing is not an option.
We are few; they are many. But the Force is our ally--and a powerful one. We will not fail.
Victory will be ours.
I've never had a reason to say this before, but... may the Force be with you.
I wouldn't mind a good fight, but I'll settle for overwhelming victory.
Consider it done.
I appreciate you lowering your standards.
If you knew how many armies I've single-handedly defeated, you wouldn't be worried.
Consider it done.
Just remember there are no reinforcements. You're all we've got.
I was looking forward to some R & R. Stomping the Empire with a beautiful woman sounds relaxing.
[Flirt] You only had to ask.
Then I may have to broaden your horizons. First things first....
You almost make it sound fun--but people are going to die.
This is no game.
I know that--and I appreciate the risk you're taking.
The longer you flap your lips, the more time the Empire has to prepare.
You're wasting time talking.
Take a speeder to the Empire's industrial complex. Look for the droid that isn't shooting at you. That's your contact.
Hurry, my heroic friends! The Empire could launch its attack against your people at any time!
Do not delay, my friend. Once the Empire chooses to attack, it moves swiftly. This may be your only chance!
You can handle this without me.
No, it can't. [Refuse quest]
If that were true, do you think I'd be begging for your help? Go on, then....
You're cute--but I'm busy. Maybe another time....
Nice outfit. You'll fit right in.
I got you the best in the galaxy, Deera. And here they are. Remember, all of you, I wasn't part of this.
